wellknown v0.7.2.91
  • Get started
  • Reference
  • Changelog

Convert WKT to GeoJSON-like objects.

Source: R/wkt2geojson.R
wkt2geojson.Rd

Convert WKT to GeoJSON-like objects.

wkt2geojson(str, fmt = 16, feature = TRUE, numeric = TRUE, simplify = FALSE)

Arguments

str

A GeoJSON-like object representing a Point, LineString, Polygon, MultiPolygon, etc.
fmt

Format string which indicates the number of digits to display after the decimal point when formatting coordinates. Max: 20
feature

(logical) Make a feature geojson object. Default: TRUE
numeric

(logical) Give back values as numeric. Default: TRUE
simplify

(logical) Attempt to simplify from a multi- geometry type to a single type. Applies to multi features only. Default: FALSE

Details

Should be robust against a variety of typing errors, including extra spaces between coordinates, no space between WKT type and coordinates. However, some things won't pass, including lowercase WKT types, no spaces between coordinates.

WKT with a 3rd value and when Z is found will be left as is and assumed to be a altitude or similar value. WKT with a 3rd value and when M is found will be discarded as the GeoJSON spec says to do so. WKT with a 4th value as (presumably as a measurement) will also be discarded.

References

https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7946

See also

geojson2wkt()

Examples

# point
str <- "POINT (-116.4000000000000057 45.2000000000000028)"
wkt2geojson(str)

#> $type
#> [1] "Feature"
#> 
#> $geometry
#> $geometry$type
#> [1] "Point"
#> 
#> $geometry$coordinates
#> [1] -116.4   45.2
#> 
#> 
#> attr(,"class")
#> [1] "geojson"
wkt2geojson(str, feature=FALSE)

#> $type
#> [1] "Point"
#> 
#> $coordinates
#> [1] -116.4   45.2
#> 
#> attr(,"class")
#> [1] "geojson"
wkt2geojson(str, numeric=FALSE)

#> $type
#> [1] "Feature"
#> 
#> $geometry
#> $geometry$type
#> [1] "Point"
#> 
#> $geometry$coordinates
#> [1] "-116.4000000000000057" "45.2000000000000028"  
#> 
#> 
#> attr(,"class")
#> [1] "geojson"
wkt2geojson("POINT (-116 45)")

#> $type
#> [1] "Feature"
#> 
#> $geometry
#> $geometry$type
#> [1] "Point"
#> 
#> $geometry$coordinates
#> [1] -116   45
#> 
#> 
#> attr(,"class")
#> [1] "geojson"
wkt2geojson("POINT (-116 45 0)")

#> $type
#> [1] "Feature"
#> 
#> $geometry
#> $geometry$type
#> [1] "Point"
#> 
#> $geometry$coordinates
#> [1] -116   45    0
#> 
#> 
#> attr(,"class")
#> [1] "geojson"
## 3D
wkt2geojson("POINT Z(100 3 35)")

#> $type
#> [1] "Feature"
#> 
#> $geometry
#> $geometry$type
#> [1] "Point"
#> 
#> $geometry$coordinates
#> [1] 100   3  35
#> 
#> 
#> attr(,"class")
#> [1] "geojson"
wkt2geojson("POINT M(100 3 35)") # dropped if M

#> $type
#> [1] "Feature"
#> 
#> $geometry
#> $geometry$type
#> [1] "Point"
#> 
#> $geometry$coordinates
#> [1] 100   3
#> 
#> 
#> attr(,"class")
#> [1] "geojson"
## 4D
wkt2geojson("POINT ZM(100 3 35 1.5)") # Z retained

#> $type
#> [1] "Feature"
#> 
#> $geometry
#> $geometry$type
#> [1] "Point"
#> 
#> $geometry$coordinates
#> [1] 100   3  35
#> 
#> 
#> attr(,"class")
#> [1] "geojson"

# multipoint
str <- 'MULTIPOINT ((100.000 3.101), (101.000 2.100), (3.140 2.180))'
wkt2geojson(str, fmt = 2)

#> $type
#> [1] "Feature"
#> 
#> $geometry
#> $geometry$type
#> [1] "MultiPoint"
#> 
#> $geometry$coordinates
#>        [,1]  [,2]
#> [1,] 100.00 3.101
#> [2,] 101.00 2.100
#> [3,]   3.14 2.180
#> 
#> 
#> attr(,"class")
#> [1] "geojson"
wkt2geojson(str, fmt = 2, feature=FALSE)

#> $type
#> [1] "MultiPoint"
#> 
#> $coordinates
#>        [,1]  [,2]
#> [1,] 100.00 3.101
#> [2,] 101.00 2.100
#> [3,]   3.14 2.180
#> 
#> attr(,"class")
#> [1] "geojson"
wkt2geojson(str, numeric=FALSE)

#> $type
#> [1] "Feature"
#> 
#> $geometry
#> $geometry$type
#> [1] "MultiPoint"
#> 
#> $geometry$coordinates
#>      [,1]                   [,2]                
#> [1,] "100.0000000000000000" "3.1010000000000000"
#> [2,] "101.0000000000000000" "2.1000000000000001"
#> [3,] "3.1400000000000001"   "2.1800000000000002"
#> 
#> 
#> attr(,"class")
#> [1] "geojson"
wkt2geojson("MULTIPOINT ((100 3), (101 2), (3 2))")

#> $type
#> [1] "Feature"
#> 
#> $geometry
#> $geometry$type
#> [1] "MultiPoint"
#> 
#> $geometry$coordinates
#>      [,1] [,2]
#> [1,]  100    3
#> [2,]  101    2
#> [3,]    3    2
#> 
#> 
#> attr(,"class")
#> [1] "geojson"
wkt2geojson("MULTIPOINT ((100 3 0), (101 2 0), (3 2 0))")

#> $type
#> [1] "Feature"
#> 
#> $geometry
#> $geometry$type
#> [1] "MultiPoint"
#> 
#> $geometry$coordinates
#>      [,1] [,2] [,3]
#> [1,]  100    3    0
#> [2,]  101    2    0
#> [3,]    3    2    0
#> 
#> 
#> attr(,"class")
#> [1] "geojson"
wkt2geojson("MULTIPOINT ((100 3 0 1), (101 2 0 1), (3 2 0 1))") 

#> $type
#> [1] "Feature"
#> 
#> $geometry
#> $geometry$type
#> [1] "MultiPoint"
#> 
#> $geometry$coordinates
#>      [,1] [,2] [,3] [,4]
#> [1,]  100    3    0    1
#> [2,]  101    2    0    1
#> [3,]    3    2    0    1
#> 
#> 
#> attr(,"class")
#> [1] "geojson"
## 3D
wkt2geojson("MULTIPOINT Z((100 3 35), (101 2 45), (3 2 89))")

#> $type
#> [1] "Feature"
#> 
#> $geometry
#> $geometry$type
#> [1] "MultiPoint"
#> 
#> $geometry$coordinates
#>      [,1] [,2] [,3]
#> [1,]  100    3   35
#> [2,]  101    2   45
#> [3,]    3    2   89
#> 
#> 
#> attr(,"class")
#> [1] "geojson"
wkt2geojson("MULTIPOINT M((100 3 1.3), (101 2 1.4), (3 2 1.9))")

#> $type
#> [1] "Feature"
#> 
#> $geometry
#> $geometry$type
#> [1] "MultiPoint"
#> 
#> $geometry$coordinates
#>      [,1] [,2]
#> [1,]  100    3
#> [2,]  101    2
#> [3,]    3    2
#> 
#> 
#> attr(,"class")
#> [1] "geojson"
## 4D
wkt2geojson("MULTIPOINT ZM((100 3 35 0), (101 2 45 0), (3 2 89 0))")

#> $type
#> [1] "Feature"
#> 
#> $geometry
#> $geometry$type
#> [1] "MultiPoint"
#> 
#> $geometry$coordinates
#>      [,1] [,2] [,3]
#> [1,]  100    3   35
#> [2,]  101    2   45
#> [3,]    3    2   89
#> 
#> 
#> attr(,"class")
#> [1] "geojson"

## simplify
wkt2geojson("MULTIPOINT ((100 3))", simplify = FALSE)

#> $type
#> [1] "Feature"
#> 
#> $geometry
#> $geometry$type
#> [1] "MultiPoint"
#> 
#> $geometry$coordinates
#>      [,1] [,2]
#> [1,]  100    3
#> 
#> 
#> attr(,"class")
#> [1] "geojson"
wkt2geojson("MULTIPOINT ((100 3))", simplify = TRUE)

#> $type
#> [1] "Feature"
#> 
#> $geometry
#> $geometry$type
#> [1] "Point"
#> 
#> $geometry$coordinates
#> [1] 100   3
#> 
#> 
#> attr(,"class")
#> [1] "geojson"


# polygon
str <- "POLYGON ((100 0.1, 101.1 0.3, 101 0.5, 100 0.1),
   (103.2 0.2, 104.8 0.2, 100.8 0.8, 103.2 0.2))"
wkt2geojson(str)

#> $type
#> [1] "Feature"
#> 
#> $geometry
#> $geometry$type
#> [1] "Polygon"
#> 
#> $geometry$coordinates
#> $geometry$coordinates[[1]]
#>       [,1] [,2]
#> [1,] 100.0  0.1
#> [2,] 101.1  0.3
#> [3,] 101.0  0.5
#> [4,] 100.0  0.1
#> 
#> $geometry$coordinates[[2]]
#>       [,1] [,2]
#> [1,] 103.2  0.2
#> [2,] 104.8  0.2
#> [3,] 100.8  0.8
#> [4,] 103.2  0.2
#> 
#> 
#> 
#> attr(,"class")
#> [1] "geojson"
wkt2geojson(str, feature=FALSE)

#> $type
#> [1] "Polygon"
#> 
#> $coordinates
#> $coordinates[[1]]
#>       [,1] [,2]
#> [1,] 100.0  0.1
#> [2,] 101.1  0.3
#> [3,] 101.0  0.5
#> [4,] 100.0  0.1
#> 
#> $coordinates[[2]]
#>       [,1] [,2]
#> [1,] 103.2  0.2
#> [2,] 104.8  0.2
#> [3,] 100.8  0.8
#> [4,] 103.2  0.2
#> 
#> 
#> attr(,"class")
#> [1] "geojson"
wkt2geojson(str, numeric=FALSE)

#> [1] "Feature"
#> 
#> $geometry
#> $geometry$type
#> [1] "Polygon"
#> 
#> $geometry$coordinates
#> $geometry$coordinates[[1]]

#> [1,] "100.0000000000000000" "0.1000000000000000"
#> [2,] "101.0999999999999943" "0.3000000000000000"
#> [3,] "101.0000000000000000" "0.5000000000000000"
#> [4,] "100.0000000000000000" "0.1000000000000000"
#> 
#> $geometry$coordinates[[2]]
#>      [,1]                   [,2]                
#> [1,] "103.2000000000000028" "0.2000000000000000"
#> [2,] "104.7999999999999972" "0.2000000000000000"
#> [3,] "100.7999999999999972" "0.8000000000000000"
#> [4,] "103.2000000000000028" "0.2000000000000000"
#> 
#> 
#> 
#> attr(,"class")
#> [1] "geojson"
## 3D
str <- "POLYGON Z((100 0.1 3, 101.1 0.3 1, 101 0.5 5, 100 0.1 8),
   (103.2 0.2 3, 104.8 0.2 4, 100.8 0.8 5, 103.2 0.2 9))"
wkt2geojson(str)

#> $type
#> [1] "Feature"
#> 
#> $geometry
#> $geometry$type
#> [1] "Polygon"
#> 
#> $geometry$coordinates
#> $geometry$coordinates[[1]]
#>       [,1] [,2] [,3]
#> [1,] 100.0  0.1    3
#> [2,] 101.1  0.3    1
#> [3,] 101.0  0.5    5
#> [4,] 100.0  0.1    8
#> 
#> $geometry$coordinates[[2]]
#>       [,1] [,2] [,3]
#> [1,] 103.2  0.2    3
#> [2,] 104.8  0.2    4
#> [3,] 100.8  0.8    5
#> [4,] 103.2  0.2    9
#> 
#> 
#> 
#> attr(,"class")
#> [1] "geojson"
## 4D
str <- "POLYGON ZM((100 0.1 3 0, 101.1 0.3 1 0, 101 0.5 5 0, 100 0.1 8 0),
   (103.2 0.2 3 0, 104.8 0.2 4 0, 100.8 0.8 5 0, 103.2 0.2 9 0))"
wkt2geojson(str)

#> $type
#> [1] "Feature"
#> 
#> $geometry
#> $geometry$type
#> [1] "Polygon"

#> $geometry$coordinates

#> [2,] 101.1  0.3    1
#> [3,] 101.0  0.5    5
#> [4,] 100.0  0.1    8
#> 
#> $geometry$coordinates[[2]]
#>       [,1] [,2] [,3]
#> [1,] 103.2  0.2    3
#> [2,] 104.8  0.2    4
#> [3,] 100.8  0.8    5
#> [4,] 103.2  0.2    9
#>

#> 
#> attr(,"class")
#> [1] "geojson"


# multipolygon
str <- "MULTIPOLYGON (((40 40, 20 45, 45 30, 40 40)),
 ((20 35, 45 20, 30 5, 10 10, 10 30, 20 35), (30 20, 20 25, 20 15, 30 20)))"
wkt2geojson(str)

#> $type
#> [1] "Feature"
#> 
#> $geometry
#> $geometry$type
#> [1] "MultiPolygon"
#> 
#> $geometry$coordinates
#> $geometry$coordinates[[1]]
#> $geometry$coordinates[[1]][[1]]
#>      [,1] [,2]
#> [1,]   40   40
#> [2,]   20   45
#> [3,]   45   30
#> [4,]   40   40
#> 
#> 
#> $geometry$coordinates[[2]]
#> $geometry$coordinates[[2]][[1]]
#>      [,1] [,2]
#> [1,]   20   35
#> [2,]   45   20
#> [3,]   30    5
#> [4,]   10   10
#> [5,]   10   30
#> [6,]   20   35
#> 
#> $geometry$coordinates[[2]][[2]]
#>      [,1] [,2]
#> [1,]   30   20
#> [2,]   20   25
#> [3,]   20   15
#> [4,]   30   20
#> 
#> 
#> 
#> 
#> attr(,"class")
#> [1] "geojson"
wkt2geojson(str, feature=FALSE)

#> $type
#> [1] "MultiPolygon"
#> 
#> $coordinates
#> $coordinates[[1]]
#> $coordinates[[1]][[1]]
#>      [,1] [,2]
#> [1,]   40   40
#> [2,]   20   45
#> [3,]   45   30
#> [4,]   40   40
#> 
#> 
#> $coordinates[[2]]
#> $coordinates[[2]][[1]]
#>      [,1] [,2]
#> [1,]   20   35
#> [2,]   45   20
#> [3,]   30    5
#> [4,]   10   10
#> [5,]   10   30
#> [6,]   20   35
#> 
#> $coordinates[[2]][[2]]
#>      [,1] [,2]
#> [1,]   30   20
#> [2,]   20   25
#> [3,]   20   15
#> [4,]   30   20
#> 
#> 
#> 
#> attr(,"class")
#> [1] "geojson"
wkt2geojson(str, numeric=FALSE)

#> $type
#> [1] "Feature"
#> 
#> $geometry
#> $geometry$type
#> [1] "MultiPolygon"
#> 
#> $geometry$coordinates
#> $geometry$coordinates[[1]]
#> $geometry$coordinates[[1]][[1]]
#>      [,1]                  [,2]                 
#> [1,] "40.0000000000000000" "40.0000000000000000"
#> [2,] "20.0000000000000000" "45.0000000000000000"
#> [3,] "45.0000000000000000" "30.0000000000000000"
#> [4,] "40.0000000000000000" "40.0000000000000000"
#> 
#> 
#> $geometry$coordinates[[2]]
#> $geometry$coordinates[[2]][[1]]
#>      [,1]                  [,2]                 
#> [1,] "20.0000000000000000" "35.0000000000000000"
#> [2,] "45.0000000000000000" "20.0000000000000000"
#> [3,] "30.0000000000000000" "5.0000000000000000" 
#> [4,] "10.0000000000000000" "10.0000000000000000"
#> [5,] "10.0000000000000000" "30.0000000000000000"
#> [6,] "20.0000000000000000" "35.0000000000000000"
#> 
#> $geometry$coordinates[[2]][[2]]
#>      [,1]                  [,2]                 
#> [1,] "30.0000000000000000" "20.0000000000000000"
#> [2,] "20.0000000000000000" "25.0000000000000000"
#> [3,] "20.0000000000000000" "15.0000000000000000"
#> [4,] "30.0000000000000000" "20.0000000000000000"
#> 
#> 
#> 
#> 
#> attr(,"class")
#> [1] "geojson"
## 3D
str <- "MULTIPOLYGON Z(((40 40 1, 20 45 3, 45 30 10, 40 40 0)),
 ((20 35 5, 45 20 67, 30 5 890, 10 10 2, 10 30 0, 20 35 4), 
 (30 20 4, 20 25 54, 20 15 56, 30 20 89)))"
wkt2geojson(str)

#> $type
#> [1] "Feature"
#> 
#> $geometry
#> $geometry$type
#> [1] "MultiPolygon"
#> 
#> $geometry$coordinates
#> $geometry$coordinates[[1]]
#> $geometry$coordinates[[1]][[1]]
#>      [,1] [,2] [,3]
#> [1,]   40   40    1
#> [2,]   20   45    3
#> [3,]   45   30   10
#> [4,]   40   40    0
#> 
#> 
#> $geometry$coordinates[[2]]
#> $geometry$coordinates[[2]][[1]]
#>      [,1] [,2] [,3]
#> [1,]   20   35    5
#> [2,]   45   20   67
#> [3,]   30    5  890
#> [4,]   10   10    2
#> [5,]   10   30    0
#> [6,]   20   35    4
#> 
#> $geometry$coordinates[[2]][[2]]
#>      [,1] [,2] [,3]
#> [1,]   30   20    4
#> [2,]   20   25   54
#> [3,]   20   15   56
#> [4,]   30   20   89
#> 
#> 
#> 
#> 
#> attr(,"class")
#> [1] "geojson"
## 4D
str <- "MULTIPOLYGON ZM(((40 40 1 0, 20 45 3 4, 45 30 10 45, 40 40 0 1)),
 ((20 35 5 8, 45 20 67 9, 30 5 890 89, 10 10 2 234, 10 30 0 5, 20 35 4 1), 
 (30 20 4 0, 20 25 54 5, 20 15 56 55, 30 20 89 78)))"
wkt2geojson(str)

#> $type
#> [1] "Feature"
#> 
#> $geometry
#> $geometry$type
#> [1] "MultiPolygon"
#> 
#> $geometry$coordinates
#> $geometry$coordinates[[1]]
#> $geometry$coordinates[[1]][[1]]
#>      [,1] [,2] [,3]
#> [1,]   40   40    1
#> [2,]   20   45    3
#> [3,]   45   30   10
#> [4,]   40   40    0
#> 
#> 
#> $geometry$coordinates[[2]]
#> $geometry$coordinates[[2]][[1]]
#>      [,1] [,2] [,3]
#> [1,]   20   35    5
#> [2,]   45   20   67
#> [3,]   30    5  890
#> [4,]   10   10    2
#> [5,]   10   30    0
#> [6,]   20   35    4
#> 
#> $geometry$coordinates[[2]][[2]]
#>      [,1] [,2] [,3]
#> [1,]   30   20    4
#> [2,]   20   25   54
#> [3,]   20   15   56
#> [4,]   30   20   89
#> 
#> 
#> 
#> 
#> attr(,"class")
#> [1] "geojson"

# simplify multipolygon to polygon if possible
str <- "MULTIPOLYGON (((40 40, 20 45, 45 30, 40 40)))"
wkt2geojson(str, simplify = FALSE)

#> $type
#> [1] "Feature"
#> 
#> $geometry
#> $geometry$type
#> [1] "MultiPolygon"
#> 
#> $geometry$coordinates
#> $geometry$coordinates[[1]]
#> $geometry$coordinates[[1]][[1]]
#>      [,1] [,2]
#> [1,]   40   40
#> [2,]   20   45
#> [3,]   45   30
#> [4,]   40   40
#> 
#> 
#> 
#> 
#> attr(,"class")
#> [1] "geojson"
wkt2geojson(str, simplify = TRUE)

#> $type
#> [1] "Feature"
#> 
#> $geometry
#> $geometry$type
#> [1] "Polygon"
#> 
#> $geometry$coordinates
#> $geometry$coordinates[[1]]
#>      [,1] [,2]
#> [1,]   40   40
#> [2,]   20   45
#> [3,]   45   30
#> [4,]   40   40
#> 
#> 
#> 
#> attr(,"class")
#> [1] "geojson"


# linestring
str <- "LINESTRING (100.000 0.000, 101.000 1.000)"
wkt2geojson(str)

#> $type
#> [1] "Feature"
#> 
#> $geometry
#> $geometry$type
#> [1] "LineString"
#> 
#> $geometry$coordinates
#>      [,1] [,2]
#> [1,]  100    0
#> [2,]  101    1
#> 
#> 
#> attr(,"class")
#> [1] "geojson"
wkt2geojson(str, feature = FALSE)

#> $type
#> [1] "LineString"
#> 
#> $coordinates
#>      [,1] [,2]
#> [1,]  100    0
#> [2,]  101    1
#> 
#> attr(,"class")
#> [1] "geojson"
wkt2geojson("LINESTRING (0 -1, -2 -3, -4 5)")

#> $type
#> [1] "Feature"
#> 
#> $geometry
#> $geometry$type
#> [1] "LineString"
#> 
#> $geometry$coordinates
#>      [,1] [,2]
#> [1,]    0   -1
#> [2,]   -2   -3
#> [3,]   -4    5
#> 
#> 
#> attr(,"class")
#> [1] "geojson"
wkt2geojson("LINESTRING (0 1 2, 4 5 6)")

#> $type
#> [1] "Feature"
#> 
#> $geometry
#> $geometry$type
#> [1] "LineString"
#> 
#> $geometry$coordinates
#>      [,1] [,2] [,3]
#> [1,]    0    1    2
#> [2,]    4    5    6
#> 
#> 
#> attr(,"class")
#> [1] "geojson"
wkt2geojson(str, numeric = FALSE)

#> $type
#> [1] "Feature"
#> 
#> $geometry
#> $geometry$type
#> [1] "LineString"
#> 
#> $geometry$coordinates
#>      [,1]                   [,2]                
#> [1,] "100.0000000000000000" "0.0000000000000000"
#> [2,] "101.0000000000000000" "1.0000000000000000"
#> 
#> 
#> attr(,"class")
#> [1] "geojson"
## 3D
wkt2geojson("LINESTRING Z(100.000 0.000 3, 101.000 1.000 5)")

#> $type
#> [1] "Feature"
#> 
#> $geometry
#> $geometry$type
#> [1] "LineString"
#> 
#> $geometry$coordinates
#>      [,1] [,2] [,3]
#> [1,]  100    0    3
#> [2,]  101    1    5
#> 
#> 
#> attr(,"class")
#> [1] "geojson"
wkt2geojson("LINESTRING M(100.000 0.000 10, 101.000 1.000 67)")

#> $type
#> [1] "Feature"
#> 
#> $geometry
#> $geometry$type
#> [1] "LineString"
#> 
#> $geometry$coordinates
#>      [,1] [,2]
#> [1,]  100    0
#> [2,]  101    1
#> 
#> 
#> attr(,"class")
#> [1] "geojson"
## 4D
wkt2geojson("LINESTRING ZM(100 0 1 4, 101 1 5 78)")

#> $type
#> [1] "Feature"
#> 
#> $geometry
#> $geometry$type
#> [1] "LineString"
#> 
#> $geometry$coordinates
#>      [,1] [,2] [,3]
#> [1,]  100    0    1
#> [2,]  101    1    5
#> 
#> 
#> attr(,"class")
#> [1] "geojson"


# multilinestring
str <- "MULTILINESTRING ((30 1, 40 30, 50 20)(10 0, 20 1))"
wkt2geojson(str)

#> $type
#> [1] "Feature"
#> 
#> $geometry
#> $geometry$type
#> [1] "MultiLineString"
#> 
#> $geometry$coordinates
#> $geometry$coordinates[[1]]
#>      [,1] [,2]
#> [1,]   30    1
#> [2,]   40   30
#> [3,]   50   20
#> 
#> $geometry$coordinates[[2]]
#>      [,1] [,2]
#> [1,]   10    0
#> [2,]   20    1
#> 
#> 
#> 
#> attr(,"class")
#> [1] "geojson"
wkt2geojson(str, numeric=FALSE)

#> $type
#> [1] "Feature"
#> 
#> $geometry
#> $geometry$type
#> [1] "MultiLineString"
#> 
#> $geometry$coordinates
#> $geometry$coordinates[[1]]
#>      [,1]                  [,2]                 
#> [1,] "30.0000000000000000" "1.0000000000000000" 
#> [2,] "40.0000000000000000" "30.0000000000000000"
#> [3,] "50.0000000000000000" "20.0000000000000000"
#> 
#> $geometry$coordinates[[2]]
#>      [,1]                  [,2]                
#> [1,] "10.0000000000000000" "0.0000000000000000"
#> [2,] "20.0000000000000000" "1.0000000000000000"
#> 
#> 
#> 
#> attr(,"class")
#> [1] "geojson"

str <- "MULTILINESTRING (
   (-105.0 39.5, -105.0 39.5, -105.0 39.5, -105.0 39.5,
     -105.0 39.5, -105.0 39.5),
   (-105.0 39.5, -105.0 39.5, -105.0 39.5),
   (-105.0 39.5, -105.0 39.5, -105.0 39.5, -105.0 39.5, -105.0 39.5),
   (-105.0 39.5, -105.0 39.5, -105.0 39.5, -105.0 39.5))"
wkt2geojson(str)

#> [1] "Feature"
#> 
#> $geometry

#> [1] "MultiLineString"

## 3D
str <- "MULTILINESTRING Z((30 1 0, 40 30 0, 50 20 0)(10 0 1, 20 1 1))"
wkt2geojson(str)

#>

#> [1] "geojson"

## 4D
str <- "MULTILINESTRING ZM((30 1 0 5, 40 30 0 7, 50 20 0 1)(10 0 1 1, 20 1 1 1))"
wkt2geojson(str)

#> [1] "Feature"
#> 
#> $geometry
#> $geometry$type
#> [1] "MultiLineString"

#>      [,1] [,2] [,3]

#> [1] "geojson"

# simplify multilinestring to linestring if possible
str <- "MULTILINESTRING ((30 1, 40 30, 50 20))"
wkt2geojson(str, simplify = FALSE)

#> $type
#> [1] "Feature"
#> 
#> $geometry
#> $geometry$type
#> [1] "MultiLineString"
#> 
#> $geometry$coordinates
#> $geometry$coordinates[[1]]
#>      [,1] [,2]
#> [1,]   30    1
#> [2,]   40   30
#> [3,]   50   20
#> 
#> 
#> 
#> attr(,"class")
#> [1] "geojson"
wkt2geojson(str, simplify = TRUE)

#> $type
#> [1] "Feature"
#> 
#> $geometry
#> $geometry$type
#> [1] "LineString"

#> $geometry$coordinates

#> [2,]   40   30
#> [3,]   50   20

#> attr(,"class")
#> [1] "geojson"


# Geometrycollection
str <- "GEOMETRYCOLLECTION (
 POINT Z(0 1 4),
 LINESTRING (-100 0, -101 -1),
 POLYGON ((100.001 0.001, 101.1235 0.0010, 101.001 1.001, 100.001 0.001),
           (100.201 0.201, 100.801 0.201, 100.801 0.801, 100.201 0.201)),
 MULTIPOINT ((100.000 3.101), (101.0 2.1), (3.14 2.18)),
 MULTILINESTRING ((0 -1, -2 -3, -4 -5),
       (1.66 -31.50, 10.0 3.0, 10.9 1.1, 0.0 4.4)),
 MULTIPOLYGON (((100.001 0.001, 101.001 0.001, 101.001 1.001, 100.001 0.001),
               (100.201 0.201, 100.801 0.201, 100.801 0.801, 100.201 0.201)),
                 ((1 2 3, 5 6 7, 9 10 11, 1 2 3))))"
wkt2geojson(str)

#> $type
#> [1] "GeometryCollection"
#> 
#> $geometries
#> $geometries[[1]]
#> $geometries[[1]]$type
#> [1] "Feature"
#> 
#> $geometries[[1]]$geometry
#> $geometries[[1]]$geometry$type
#> [1] "Point"
#> 
#> $geometries[[1]]$geometry$coordinates
#> [1] 0 1 4
#> 
#> 
#> 
#> $geometries[[2]]

#> [1] "Feature"
#> 
#> $geometries[[2]]$geometry
#> $geometries[[2]]$geometry$type
#> [1] "LineString"
#> 
#> $geometries[[2]]$geometry$coordinates

#> [1,] -100    0
#> [2,] -101   -1

# case doesn't matter
str <- "point (-116.4000000000000057 45.2000000000000028)"
wkt2geojson(str)

#> $type
#> [1] "Feature"
